newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sweden says will not join EMU at 1999 start.
newsitem.headline: Sweden says will not join EMU at 1999 start.

text.p: Sweden's Prime Minister Goran Persson said on Tuesday the country would not join Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU) at the proposed start in January 1999.
The statement marked the first time the ruling party has publicly stated its views on possible Swedish EMU membership.
However, Persson said Sweden would join EMU when it was possible, and it was not closing the door completely.
"Our decision not to join does not apply indefinitely in the future. There can be a situation in the next mandate period (to 2002) when we would attempt to join," Persson told reporters.
"If we decide to join we want to have the maximum power to negotiate," he said.
Persson said reasons behind Sweden's decision not to join included negative public opinion, while the project was uncertain and shaky.
Persson said a decision about Sweden joining EMU would be made only after some type of poll.
"This could be a general election, an extra parliamentary election or a referendum," he said.
